case_vignette: A 26-year-old man presents to the behavioral health clinic for assistance overcoming his fear of public speaking. He has always hated public speaking. Two weeks ago, he was supposed to present a research project at school but had to leave the podium before the presentation. He recalled that his heart was racing, his palms were sweating, and that he could not breathe. These symptoms resolved on their own after several minutes, but he felt too embarrassed to return to college the next day. This had also happened in high school where, before a presentation, he started sweating and felt palpitations and nausea that also resolved on their own. He is scheduled for another presentation next month and is terrified. He states that this only happens in front of large groups and that he has no problems communicating at small gatherings. Other than his fear of public speaking, he has a normal social life and many friends. He enjoys his classes and a part-time job.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I get really nervous, my heart starts racing, my palms sweat, and I feel like I can't breathe when I have to speak in front of a lot of people.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
It has happened since high school and it also happened two weeks ago.
How old are you now?
I'm 26 years old.
Do these symptoms occur only in situations where you have to speak in public or also in other situations?
These symptoms only happen when I have to speak in front of large groups; I'm fine in small gatherings.
Do you have any other medical conditions or are you currently on any medication?
No, I don't have any other medical conditions and I'm not on any medication.
Does anyone in your family have a history of anxiety disorders or related conditions?
I don't know, we've never talked about that in my family.
**Final Diagnosis:** Social anxiety disorder (social phobia).

There's no mention of a family history of this issue.
